content.description:
Fun two-pitch route that rambles a bit but has a few sections of good climbing.

Pitch 1: Climb up into an obtuse right-facing corner. Pull the quick layback (super fun) and ramble up and slightly left on easier terrain to the base of a 20ft bolder near the top split by a left-angling thin hands crack. (5.7)

Pitch 2: Climb the left-angling thin hands crack. Small but good feet appear to supplement the somewhat strenuous crack moves. This would probably be 5.7+ in J Tree so happy to adjust if someone disagrees. I found it a bit awkward. (5.9+)
content.location: Pretty obvious line up a right-facing corner when approaching the outcropping from the South.

content.description: Another quick fun route up a wide crack / chimney and onto an airy arete. Lots of ways to climb this one but the arete finish was a blast.
content.protection: Standard rack. #4 was helpful but not necessary
